qas.question: What does any living organism rely on to be able to grow and reproduce?
How many daily calories are recommended for a human adult?
Where are food molecules oxidised to carbon dioxide and water?
What does any dead organism rely on to be able to grow and reproduce?
How many weekly calories are recommended for a human adult?
Where are food molecules oxidised to oxygen and water?
what relies on an internal source of energy
radiation from the Sun in the case of red what?

context: <b6_0>Any living organism<b6_0/> relies on <a0_0><b3_0>an external source of energy<b3_0/><a0_0/>—radiation from the Sun in the case of green <b7_0>plants<b7_0/>, chemical energy in some form in the case of animals—to be able to grow and reproduce. The daily <a1_0><b4_0>1500–2000<b4_0/><a1_0/> Calories (6–8 MJ) recommended for a human adult are taken as a combination of oxygen and food molecules, the latter mostly carbohydrates and fats, of which glucose (C6H12O6) and stearin (C57H110O6) are convenient examples. The food molecules are oxidised to carbon dioxide and water in the <a2_0><b5_0>mitochondria
